alert.note: Alert for Coastal Palm Beach County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued November 26 at 2:49AM EST until November 26 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Statement, isolated minor coastal flooding during periods of high tide. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Coastal Palm Beach County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Statement, through Monday morning. For the High Rip Current Risk, from 10 AM EST this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads and property. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
